definitions.definition: A soldier of the lowest rank in the army.
A doctor working in privately rather than publicly funded health care.
A secret message; a personal unofficial communication.
One not invested with a public office.
(usually in the plural) A private lesson.
definitions.example: If you want to learn ballet, consider taking privates.

definitions.definition: Belonging to, concerning, or accessible only to an individual person or a specific group.
definitions.example: Her address is private; you can't have it.

definitions.definition: Not in governmental office or employment.
definitions.example: He quit public life, living quietly as a private citizen.

definitions.definition: Not publicly known; not open; secret.
definitions.example: The identity of the beneficiaries of the trust is private.

definitions.definition: Protected from view or disturbance by others; secluded.
definitions.example: Can we go somewhere more private?
He is a very private person.

definitions.definition: (of a room in a medical facility) Not shared with another patient.
Accessible only to the class itself or instances of it, and not to other classes or even subclasses.
